definition: A term commonly employed to refer to a specific type of flightless aquatic bird species, typically found in cold regions. These creatures are known for their distinct black and white coloration, as well as their unique waddling gait on land and their exceptional swimming abilities in water. They are often associated with icy environments and are frequently depicted in popular culture due to their charming appearance and behavior.

examples.german: Pinguine leben hauptsächlich in der Antarktis.
Pinguine haben eine dicke Fettschicht, um sich vor der Kälte zu schützen.
examples.english: Penguins have a thick layer of fat to protect themselves from the cold.

examples.german: Pinguine ernähren sich hauptsächlich von Fischen und Krill.
examples.english: Penguins mainly feed on fish and krill.
